Class Hierarchy

Go to the graphical class hierarchy

This inheritance list is sorted roughly, but not completely, alphabetically:
[detail level 12]
 CArmUs
 ▼CArmUsInfoClass that controls the arm. Contains a virtual void function, cannot be instantiated. Instead, instantiate either Arm Us Info Real or Arm Us Info Simul depending on the control mode. The two derived classes exist because the implementation of the controls are different in each one
 CArmUsInfoRealDerived class from Arm Us Info Used to control the arm in real time with Dynamixels connected
 CArmUsInfoSimulDerived class from Arm Us Info Used to simulate the motors to debug
 CController::ButtonData structure that holds information about 4 buttons. Buttons have an int value of 0 or 1
 CControllerData structure that holds information about the state of a controller. Is used of ease of use when receiving messages of type sensor_msgs::Joy so that the information is accessible with more intuitive names
 CController::DirectionPadData structure that holds information about a direction pad. Vertical axis is an int value of -1, 0 or 1 Horizontal axis is an int value of -1, 0 or 1
 CController::JoystickData structure that holds information about a joystick. Vertical axis is a float value between -1.0 and 1.0 Horizontal axis is a float value between -1.0 and 1.0
 CController::TriggerData structure that holds information about a trigger. Vertical axis is an int value of 0 or 1 Horizontal axis is an int value of 0 or 1
 CArmUsInfo::Vector3fData structure that holds 3 floats : x, y, z Used for the cartesian velocity commands sent and the joint velocities returned
 CArmUsInfo::Vector5bData structure that holds 5 booleans : m1, m2, m3, m4, m5 Used for joint limits of the arm
 CArmUsInfo::Vector5fData structure that holds 5 floats : m1, m2, m3, m4, m5 Used for motor positions, angles, velocities
